com.tradersgem2.database

Class UserAccountsDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tradersgem2.database.UserAccountsDB
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<UserAccount>

    public class UserAccountsDB
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<UserAccount>
    Model for the User Accounts, this class is used to communicate with the DB to fetch information, manage users accounts and a whole and also each user account individually. It allows the creation of new accounts, and provides methods to change the password.
    Author:
    Pedro Miranda

    • Method Detail

      • verifyCredentials

        public boolean verifyCredentials(java.lang.String userName,
                        java.lang.String password)
        Verifies that there is a user account that exists matching the user name and password entered by the user.
        Parameters:
        userName - - A String containing the user name the current user.
        password - - A String containing the password the users account.
        Returns:
        - A boolean value of true if the user name and password match an account or false if the is no account that matches the entered credentials.

      • getCurrentUser

        public UserAccount getCurrentUser()
        Gets a immutable copy of the current user's account who has logged into the system.
        Returns:
        - A immutable copy of the current user's account.

      • createNewAccount

        public boolean createNewAccount(java.lang.String userName,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String confPassword)
                         throws UserAccountsExc
        Creates a new user account as adds it to the database, granted the user name does not already exist and that the password and confirm password match.
        Parameters:
        userName - - A String containing the desired user name.
        password - - A String containing the desired password.
        confPassword - - A String containing the confirmation of the password entered above.
        Returns:
        - A message stating if the new user account was created successfully, the passwords do not match, or the username already exists.
        Throws:
        UserAccountsExc - - An exception if an error occurs during the password creation.

      • getNumOfAccounts

        public int getNumOfAccounts()
        Get the number of user accounts in the Database
        Returns:
        - An integer containing the number of accounts in the Database

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Reloads all the accounts in the database.

        public java.util.Iterator<UserAccount> iterator()
